response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  i = i + 1;
    names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a variable in a method: I have a method that takes a variable as a parameter and I want to get the value of that variable in the method.
public class Test {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        int i = 10;
        Test test = new Test();
        System.out.println(test.getVariable());
    }
    public int getVariable() {
        return i;
    }
}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
